title: Thermal Mechanical Engineer - Remote - Semiconductors
description:
About the job
Mackenzie Stuart is partnered with a rapidly growing deep-tech start-up at the forefront of developing next-generation photonic hardware for extreme-performance data communication and AI computing systems to identify a Thermal Mechanical Engineer with strong background in photonics packaging. 

Key Responsibilities: 
Formulate and refine packaging solutions focused on thermal control, mechanical robustness, electrical connectivity, and optical performance. 
Innovate and design thermal solutions to regulate heat emitted by electronic components and photonic devices using methods like heat sinks and cooling mechanisms. 
Strategically select materials for packaging, emphasizing thermal conductivity, insulation, and environmental resistance. 
Develop hermetic or environmentally sealed packages to protect components against contaminants. 
Create precise mechanical interfaces for seamless integration using CAD software (SolidWorks, AutoCAD). 
Conduct thermal analysis using tools like ANSYS, COMSOL, or SolidWorks Simulation.

Qualifications: 
Bachelor’s, Master’s, or Ph.D. in Mechanical Engineering or a related field. 
Minimum of 5 years of experience in thermal mechanical engineering. 
Proficiency in CAD software for package design and integration. 
Strong understanding of thermal management principles and material properties. 
Knowledge of photonics and/or semiconductor fabrication is a strong plus.

Compensation: 
Competitive salary, equity, and comprehensive benefits/vacation package.

Location: 
Fully remote work is allowed, with initial travel to offices in Switzerland.

Mackenzie Stuart is a leading executive search and selection business. title: Thermal Engineer (all genders)
description:
About the job
Join the Pinnacle of Satellite Technology Advancement in Germany!

Reflex Aerospace is at the forefront of propelling high-performance satellite technology to new heights within the German aerospace landscape.

As part of Reflex Aerospace, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the trajectory of the space industry's future. This is an opportunity to contribute your expertise and enthusiasm to a team that stands for innovation and excellence. If you are ready to take on exciting challenges and be part of a company that is redefining the boundaries of satellite technology, we welcome you to embark on this thrilling journey with us!

Your Mission

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Thermal Engineer to join our team. As a member of a cross-functional team, you will play a critical role in our satellite design, ensuring optimal thermal performance in the harsh and variable space environment.

You will contribute to the top-level design and requirement definition. Your expertise in thermal engineering will be invaluable in ensuring that all satellite components operate within temperature limits throughout their mission lifecycle.

Responsible for analysis, conceptual sizing, and design of thermal control system
Develop thermal models and conduct analyses to predict satellite thermal performance.
Support thermal and thermal-vacuum testing of satellites and satellite sub-systems.
Provide consultation to hardware developers in design decisions and material selection.
Prepare and maintain technical documentation, including design specifications and test reports.
Manage thermal interfaces with external vendors and partners to ensure optimal thermal system performance.

Your Background

Bachelor's degree in Aerospace Engineering, related field, or equivalent work experience.
Minimum of 3 years of experience in thermal system design, analysis, and testing.
Knowledge of the design and lifecycle of satellites and their subsystems.
Proficiency in thermal modeling and simulation tools such as Simcenter 3D.
Ability to work independently as well as part of a cross-functional team.
Excellent communication skills in English.

What We Offer

Collaborate with a diverse multinational team crafting the next wave of cutting-edge satellites. Embark on this exciting journey with us from the outset, leaving your indelible mark on a dynamic company and playing a direct role in shaping the future of the space industry. 
Keep your energy levels high with company-sponsored memberships for Urban Sports Club and Swapfiets. 
We provide a hybrid work model along with flexible working hours, empowering you as the owner of your time management. 
Nestled in the heart of Friedrichshain, our Berlin office provides a lively and central hub easily accessible by transit. Immerse yourself in a neighborhood teeming with vibrant restaurants and year-round cultural events. 
Enjoy the flexibility of ample vacation time, including a special company holiday on April 12th dedicated to celebrating the International Day of Human Spaceflight.

Join Reflex Aerospace and be a driving force in shaping the next era of space exploration! We look forward to your application.

About Us

Reflex Aerospace, a NewSpace startup founded in 2021 and headquartered in Munich and Berlin, has been leading the charge to provide advanced dual-use satellite technology at unparalleled speed. The company is leveraging the latest techniques to modernize payload-centric satellite development and production, achieving significantly faster delivery times and enhanced reliability. By applying algorithmic engineering and streamlined system design processes, Reflex accelerates the delivery of satellites enabling lightning-fast innovation for our customers.
